intro: Polygonum serrulatum var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered smartweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive nodes and bracts. The plant features slender, upright stems that are often reddish in color, and its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges. The flowers are small and clustered in dense, cylindrical spikes, with white petals that give it its common name. It thrives in wet or moist soils and is often found in marshy areas or along streambanks.
